Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rev. Melvin E. Wilson, Pastor, St. Luke A.M.E. Church, 1872 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Melvin E. Wilson, Pastor, St. Luke A.M.E. Church, 1872 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, N.Y.
Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a moment of silence in memory of the following individual:
Army Specialist Brian Ritzberg, 24, of Long Island City, Queens who died on April 2, 2007 of wounds sustained in a suicide truck bomb attack in Iraq.  Specialist Ritzberg was assigned to the 977th Military Police Company, 1st Infantry Division.  He leaves behind his wife, Clara, his father, two half-brothers and grandmother.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gentile moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 14, 2007 be adopted as printed.

By Council Member Brewer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 060381 ZSM, a special permit to allow an attended public parking garage at 555West 59th Street, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 555 W. 59th Street, Manhattan (C060381ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution designating the week of April 15 to April 21 to be known and celebrated as “Library Week” in New York City
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, LIbraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Designating the week of April 15 to April 21  to be known and celebrated as “Library Week” in NYC.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Education
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the protection of public employee whistleblowers.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Protecting department of education employees from certain adverse personnel action.

Items.Title: Resolution endorsing the Speaker’s decision to join with the Administration in filing, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between individual tenants and landlords captioned Rosario v. Diagonal Realty LLC for the purpose of supporting Local Law 44 of 1993 amending the City’s J-51 tax abatement program to prohibit discrimination by landlords against tenants using or participating in government funded housing assistance programs including Section 8.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Gallagher, Ignizio and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Filing, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of the Plaintiffs in the litigation between individual tenants and landlords captioned Rosario v. Diagonal Realty LLC.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.645, the “New York Consumer and Worker Protection Act,” which would require businesses and government entities to comply with certain conditions with respect to the outsourcing of jobs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass A.645, the “New York Consumer and Worker Protection Act”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation to increase penalties for physical assaults on the elderly.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increase penalties for physical assaults on the elderly.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A. 0697, which would amend the public authorities law, in relation to establishing a no fare program for transportation on the New York City Transit Authority system, the Long Island Rail Road, and the Metro-North Commuter Railroad Company for senior citizens.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Establishing a no fare program for transportation on the NYCTA system, the Long Island Rail Road, and the Metro-North Commuter Railroad Company for senior citizens. (A.0697)

Diagonal Realty LLC for the purpose of supporting Local Law 44 of 1993 amending the City’s J-51 tax abatement program to prohibit discrimination by landlords against tenants using or participating in government funded housing assistance programs including Section 8.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York to require notification to the Council of the city of New York of emergency procurements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: NYC charter to require notification to the Council of the city of NY of emergency procurements.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the 10% For Youth Campaign for urging that budget surpluses  be used to guarantee summer jobs for every teen, a Beacon program for every neighborhood, and an expansion of dropout/pushout programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Commending the 10% For Youth Campaign for urging that budget surpluses be used to guarantee summer jobs for every teen, a Beacon program for every neighborhood, and an expansion of dropout/pushout programs.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Mayor of NYC  to use City employees rather than private consultants and contractors to provide City services that can be performed by City employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring any person who marks a street or sidewalk for the purpose of paving, maintaining or restoring said street or sidewalk to remove all such marks once the work is complete.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring any person who marks a street or sidewalk for the purpose of paving, maintaining or restoring said street or sidewalk to remove all such marks once the work is complete.

Items.MatterName: Creating criminal and civil penalties for damaging items of religious worship or religious articles that are contained on private property.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an alternative enforcement program by the department of housing preservation and development for violations of the housing maintenance code and multiple dwelling law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Alternative enforcement program by the department of housing preservation and development for violations of the housing maintenance code and multiple dwelling law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to reintroduce and pass the Second Chance Act of 2005, which would reauthorize a Department of Justice grant program that, among other things, facilitates the reentry of offenders into the community and establishes a task force on Federal programs and activities relating to the reentry of offenders into the community.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Congress to reintroduce and pass the Second Chance Act of 2005.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to serial acts of public lewdness.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establishing certain penalties for the offense of public lewdness.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the definition of drug, as used in the sections of the Vehicle and Traffic Law that relate to the offenses of operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs, to permit the arrest and charging under those sections of individuals under the influence of chemical compounds found in products that can be abused as inhalants.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the definition of drug, as used in the sections of the Vehicle and Traffic Law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of City Planning to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to creating R2-N, a contextual Residence District for areas with single-family homes on lots less than forty feet in width.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Department of City Planning to file an application to amend the text of the Zoning Resolution in regard to creating R2-N.
